org.keyple.seproxy

Class ObservableReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.keyple.seproxy.ObservableReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProxyReader

    public abstract class ObservableReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProxyReader
    The Interface ObservableReader. In order to notify a ticketing application in case of specific reader events, the SE Proxy implements the ‘Observer’ design pattern. The ObservableReader object is optionally proposed by plugins for readers able to notify events in case of IO Error, SE Insertion or removal.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.List<ReaderObserver> readerObservers
      an array referencing the registered ReaderObserver of the Reader.

      void addObserver(ReaderObserver observer)
      Add an observer to a terminal reader.
      void deleteObserver(ReaderObserver observer)
      Remove an observer from a terminal reader.
      void notifyObservers(ReaderEvent event)
      This method shall be called only from a SE Proxy plugin by a reader implementing ObservableReader push a ReaderEvent of the selected ObservableReader to its registered ReaderObserver.

    • Method Detail

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver(ReaderObserver observer)
        Add an observer to a terminal reader. This will allow to be notified about all card insertion/removal events. Please note that you shouldn't reuse the notification threads for your card processing logic.
        Parameters:
        observer - Observer to notify

      • deleteObserver

        public void deleteObserver(ReaderObserver observer)
        Remove an observer from a terminal reader.
        Parameters:
        observer - Observer to stop notifying

      • notifyObservers

        public final void notifyObservers(ReaderEvent event)
        This method shall be called only from a SE Proxy plugin by a reader implementing ObservableReader push a ReaderEvent of the selected ObservableReader to its registered ReaderObserver.
        Parameters:
        event - the event
